text.p: These are the leading stories in the Angolan press on Tuesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The U.N. representative to Angola, Alioune Blondin Beye, announced on Monday that UNITA deputies would be sworn into the National Assembly on April 9 and the unity government would be established on April 11.
- Defence Minister Pedro Sebastiao told national radio that the military situation around the country was calm, but said instability still plagued Cabinda province.
- The Angolan frontiers and immigration directorate said it would start vigorous enforcement of the border region in Lunda Norte province to keep out illegal diamond traders from Zaire.
